name: chipseq-histone-modifications
title: ChIP-seq Histone Modification Profiling
description: Map histone modifications genome-wide to identify active enhancers, promoters, and repressed regions. Broad peak calling with MACS3 for chromatin state analysis. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,replicate,antibody,control`
content:
ChIP-seq for Histone Modifications

Histone ChIP-seq maps post-translational modifications on histone proteins to reveal chromatin states across the genome. Unlike TF ChIP-seq with narrow peaks, histone marks create broad domains reflecting active or repressed chromatin.

What Are Histone Modifications?

Histones package DNA into nucleosomes. Chemical modifications (acetylation, methylation) on histone tails regulate:

  • Gene Activity: Active vs repressed genes
  • Chromatin State: Open (euchromatin) vs closed (heterochromatin)
  • Regulatory Elements: Enhancers, promoters, insulators
  • DNA Repair: Damage response
  • Replication: Origin firing

Key Histone Marks

Active Marks:

  • H3K4me3: Active promoters (TSS)
  • H3K4me1: Enhancers (distal regulatory elements)
  • H3K27ac: Active enhancers + promoters (acetylation = active)
  • H3K36me3: Actively transcribed gene bodies
  • H3K9ac: Active transcription

Repressive Marks:

  • H3K27me3: Polycomb repression (developmental genes)
  • H3K9me3: Heterochromatin (repetitive DNA, silenced genes)
  • H4K20me3: Constitutive heterochromatin

Bivalent/Poised:

  • H3K4me3 + H3K27me3: Poised genes (ready to activate in development)

Chromatin State Signatures

Genomic RegionHistone MarksFunction
Active PromoterH3K4me3, H3K27acTranscription start site
Active EnhancerH3K4me1, H3K27acDistal regulation
Poised EnhancerH3K4me1 onlyReady to activate
Gene BodyH3K36me3Actively transcribed
Polycomb RepressedH3K27me3Developmental silencing
HeterochromatinH3K9me3Permanent silencing
Bivalent PromoterH3K4me3 + H3K27me3Poised for activation

Why Histone ChIP-seq?

  • Chromatin State Maps: Define regulatory landscape
  • Enhancer Discovery: Find distal regulatory elements
  • Epigenetic Regulation: Gene control without DNA changes
  • Cell Identity: Cell-type specific chromatin patterns
  • Disease Epigenetics: Aberrant chromatin in cancer, neurodegeneration
  • Drug Discovery: Target epigenetic enzymes (HDAC inhibitors, BET inhibitors)

Broad Peaks for Histones

Histone modifications span large domains (1-10kb), not sharp sites:

  • MACS3 broad peak mode: Detects extended enrichment regions
  • H3K27me3: Can span entire genes (10-100kb)
  • H3K9me3: Large heterochromatic blocks (Mb scale)
  • Active marks: Typically 1-5kb around promoters/enhancers

Pipeline automatically uses appropriate peak calling for histone marks

Pipeline Analysis

  1. Quality Control: FastQC, adapter trimming
  2. Alignment: BWA/Bowtie2 maps reads to genome
  3. Filtering: Remove duplicates, low-quality reads, blacklisted regions
  4. Peak Calling: MACS3 broad peak mode for histone marks
  5. Peak Annotation: Assign peaks to genomic features
  6. Differential Analysis: Compare conditions (DiffBind)
  7. Chromatin State: ChromHMM segmentation (if multiple marks)
  8. Visualization: BigWig tracks for genome browser

Scientific Questions

  • Regulatory Landscape: Where are enhancers in this cell type?
  • Active vs Repressed Genes: Chromatin state at gene loci
  • Disease Chromatin: How does chromatin change in cancer?
  • Drug Effects: Do HDAC inhibitors alter acetylation?
  • Development: Poised genes activating during differentiation
  • Super-Enhancers: Clusters of H3K27ac at cell identity genes
  • Epigenetic Memory: H3K27me3 inheritance through cell division

Applications

  • Cancer: EZH2 overexpression → increased H3K27me3 → gene silencing
  • Stem Cells: Bivalent chromatin at developmental genes
  • Aging: Loss of H3K9me3 at heterochromatin
  • Neurodegeneration: Altered H3K4me3 at synaptic genes
  • Immunology: Enhancer remodeling during immune activation
  • Drug Discovery: Epigenetic drugs (BET inhibitors target acetyl-lysine readers)

Recommended Mark Combinations

Enhancer Discovery: H3K4me1 + H3K27ac

Active Transcription: H3K4me3 + H3K36me3 + H3K27ac

Repression Analysis: H3K27me3 + H3K9me3

Complete Chromatin State: 6-12 marks for ChromHMM segmentation

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with columns:

  • sample: Sample name
  • fastq_1: Path to R1 FASTQ
  • fastq_2: Path to R2 FASTQ (for paired-end)
  • antibody: Histone mark (e.g., H3K4me3, H3K27ac)
  • control: Matching input control sample

Key Outputs

  • Broad Peaks: BED files with histone modification domains
  • BigWig Tracks: Genome browser visualization
  • Peak Annotations: Genes and regulatory elements
  • Chromatin States: Segmentation into functional states
  • Differential Regions: Condition-specific chromatin changes
  • QC Report: Quality metrics, FRiP scores
  • Heatmaps: Signal at promoters/enhancers

Perfect for: Chromatin states • Enhancer discovery • Epigenetic regulation • Cell identity • Disease epigenetics • Drug response
